description:
We Put the World on Vacation
At Travel + Leisure Co., our mission is simple: to put the world on vacation. With a focus on vacation ownership, travel memberships, and exchange programs, we’re shaping the future of leisure travel by creating new possibilities for vacationers. Innovation and growth keep our work interesting and fun. Every day is a chance to learn something new and turn vacation inspiration into exceptional experiences for millions of travelers worldwide.

The Director, Brand Business Partner is a critical role as part of the Brand Strategy team in the Global Brand, Communications, and Digital organization. The role consists of partnering with the various business lines on annual planning as it relates to brand, partnerships, communications, insights and digital support. This leader will help manifest the Travel + Leisure enterprise promise – “ We put the world on vacation ” – through supporting strong performance of our existing business lines. The Director, Brand Business Partner will be focused on partnering with the business and the brand, partnerships, communications, insights and digital organizations to facilitate aligned planning, resources and support of the business. The leader identifies opportunities, based on organizational objectives and coordinates a multidisciplinary approach to review, gain approval across stakeholders, and ensure implementation. Success in the position demands a driving focus on creation of shareholder value and earnings, as well as a passion to champion business opportunities that build brand equity, drive financial performance, and yield organizational efficiencies. At times, this position may also support special projects for the Chief Brand, Communications and Digital Officer. The position reports into the SVP, Brand Strategy.

How You'll Shine
• Brand Business Partner (45%): Collaborate with senior leaders and their teams from each business unit to support business and new growth strategies from a brand, partnerships, insights, communications and digital perspective through annual planning and performance focused QBRs.
• Internal Planning (30%): Collaborate with the brand, partnerships, insights, communications and digital teams to prioritize and execute against annual plans for each business unit. Ensure plan is aligned with and supports enterprise priorities.
• KPI Tracking (25%): Develop a method by which all brand organization functions can provide rollup reporting on metrics for analysis and communication back to business unit stakeholders. Manage related budget and resourcing plans, and be a fiduciary steward of the company.

What You'll Bring

Education
• BA in Business, Marketing, Hospitality or related field. Master’s degree preferred.

Knowledge and skills
• Expert understanding of branding and marketing practices and structure.
• Ability to identify key drivers and alignment opportunities in the business.
• Ability to develop, monitor and communicate key performance indicators and measurement.
• Problem solver and a visionary to see beyond the day-to-day and offer new solutions versus the status quo.
• Leadership, influence, and communications skills at all levels of the organization in a collaborative way that builds credibility.
• Develop authentic, productive relationships with internal and external partners.
• Build consensus and alignment but not afraid to push ahead on the vision.
• Passionate about leading, managing and inspiring people and solutions.
• Strong emotional intelligence to lead and develop others in a fast-paced and changing environment.

Technical Skills
• Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and various data and insights analysis tools.

Job experience
• 7+ years of leadership experience in travel, leisure, hospitality and/or lifestyle brands. Experience in vacation ownership business and/or subscription segment would be preferred.
• 9+ years of leadership experience in business strategy, brand marketing, innovation or related function, demonstrating progressive career growth and pattern of exceptional performance. Strong understanding of brand or portfolio strategy, marketing and performance measurement.

Experience equivalent to the education requirement may be accepted in lieu of the education requirement.

How You'll Be Rewarded:

We offer a diverse range of comprehensive health and welfare benefits to associates who work 30 or more hours per week to meet your needs and support you throughout your career with us. Travel + Leisure Co. benefits include:

Note: Temporary and/or seasonal associates are ineligible for Paid Time Off.
• Medical
• Dental
• Vision
• Flexible spending accounts
• Life and accident coverage
• Disability
• Depending on position, paid time off, parental leave and holidays (speak to your recruiter for additional information)
• Wish day paid time to volunteer at an approved organization of your choice
• 401k with employer match (subject to eligibility requirements, including tenure - speak to your recruiter for additional information)
• Legal and identify theft plan
• Voluntary income protection benefits
• Wellness program (subject to provider availability)
• Employee Assistance Program

Where Memories Start with You

Hospitality is at the heart of all we do at Travel + Leisure Co. Here, you’ll find an inclusive environment where we deliver excellence and take time to have fun, celebrate together, and support one another. We're always looking ahead to what’s next and how we can strengthen our business, its neighboring communities, and the customer experience. Join our global team and build a career where memories start with you.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all applications will be considered for employment without attention to their membership in any protected class. If you require any reasonable accommodation to complete your application or any part of the recruiting process, please email your request to View email address on careers.travelandleisureco.com , including the title and location of the position for which you are applying.
